name: Veterinary Street Outreach Services (Vet SOS)
description: Vet SOS provides free veterinary care to the companion animals of homeless San Franciscans and links their human guardians with health care services. They offer twice monthly pop-up veterinary clinics. All visits are by appointment only. They also provide weekly curbside delivery of free pet food and supplies as well as telemedicine and medication refills for current clients (by appointment). • On-site veterinary wellness exams including vaccinations, routine procedures, and laboratory testing •

They offer twice monthly pop-up veterinary clinics. All visits are by appointment only. They also provide weekly curbside delivery of free pet food and supplies as well as telemedicine and medication refills for current clients (by appointment). • On-site veterinary wellness exams including vaccinations, routine procedures, and laboratory testing •
howToGetIt: If you're a person experiencing homelessness with a companion animal, please call (415) 355-2237 or email vetsos@sfccc.org for more information or to make an appointment.
